conclusion: The formula v^2 = v0^2 + 2 a (x - x0) is valid for constant acceleration at x1.
Work-energy principle confirms v1 = sqrt(2 a0 x1).
Re-evaluation using acceleration definition confirms v1 = sqrt(2 a0 x1).
Unit analysis confirms the correctness of v1 = sqrt(2 a0 x1).
Physical reasoning confirms no other forces affect velocity at x1.
